data.current_description: An endpoint for automation systems to log spins into the spin table.
data.summary_suggestion: Log a spin to the spin table
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new spin record in the spin table. Designed for automation systems to log music plays and related metadata. Requires authentication via API key. Accepts spin details in the request body (e.g., artist, track, timestamp, show association). Returns the created Spin object with a 201 status code. The spin becomes immediately available for querying via the API.
data.reasoning: Original description is too generic and lacks critical details for AI agent usage. Added: (1) explicit action (creates), (2) target audience (automation systems), (3) authentication requirement, (4) input expectations, (5) response details including status code, (6) side effect (spin becomes queryable). This helps agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific spin record by its unique identifier. Returns the complete Spin object containing details such as artist, track, album, timestamp, show association, and other metadata. Requires authentication via API key. The spin must exist in the database; requesting a non-existent spin ID returns a 404 error.

message: Operation 'get_/personas' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, unclear_purpose, missing_output_details. Original summary is too generic. Description is completely missing. Added domain context (radio DJs/hosts), clarified what personas represent, mentioned pagination support, and specified return format for AI agent clarity.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all Persona objects representing radio DJs/hosts. Each persona describes a radio personality who may host one or more shows. Results can be filtered and paginated using query parameters. Returns an array of Persona objects ordered by id.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description is completely missing. Added domain context (radio DJs/hosts), clarified what personas represent, mentioned pagination support, and specified return format for AI agent clarity.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a single Persona object by its unique identifier. Returns the persona details including name, bio, and associated show information. Status 404 is returned if the persona with the specified id does not exist.

message: Operation 'get_/playlists' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_output_details, vague_description. Summary is adequate. Description lacks context about what playlists represent (tracks played during shows), doesn't explain pagination, and doesn't clarify the return format. Added domain context and details about pagination for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Returns playlists optionally filtered by {start} and/or {end} datetimes
data.current_description:
Get Playlists optionally filtered by a datetime range.
Only past Playlists will be returned (with allowed tolerance equals 1 hour in future).

Ordered chronologically from newest to oldest.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of Playlist objects representing past radio show playlists, optionally filtered by a datetime range. Only playlists that have already aired are returned, with a 1-hour future tolerance. Results are ordered chronologically from newest to oldest. Each playlist contains the spins (tracks) played during a show. Returns an array of Playlist objects with pagination metadata.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate. Description lacks context about what playlists represent (tracks played during shows), doesn't explain pagination, and doesn't clarify the return format. Added domain context and details about pagination for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'get_/playlists/{id}' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, vague_description. Summary is adequate. Description lacks detail about what the playlist contains (spins/tracks) and what information is returned. Added specifics about playlist contents and return structure for improved AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
The response object represents the playlist specified by {id}.

Status 404 is returned if a playlist with {id} does not exist or if it does but starts in the future (with allowed tolerance equals 1 hour in future).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a single Playlist object by its unique identifier. Returns the playlist details including all spins (tracks) played during the show, show information, and timing metadata. Status 404 is returned if the playlist with the specified id does not exist or if it starts in the future (with 1-hour tolerance).
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate. Description lacks detail about what the playlist contains (spins/tracks) and what information is returned. Added specifics about playlist contents and return structure for improved AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Returns spins optionally filtered by {start} and/or {end} datetimes
data.current_description: Get Spins optionally filtered by a datetime range. Only past Spins will be returned.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of Spin objects representing individual track plays, optionally filtered by a datetime range. Only spins that have already aired are returned. Each spin represents a single track played on a show, including artist, album, and timing information. Results are ordered chronologically. Returns an array of Spin objects with pagination metadata.
